items.name: CustomEffectCollection
items.content:
# ===================================================================
#
#   Script: CustomEffectCollection
#
#   $$COPYRIGHT$$
#
# ===================================================================
class CustomEffectCollection extends gs.EffectCollection
    ###*
    * An effect collection stores all effects by name. So if you add custom effects, you
    * have to create an own class and inherit from gs.EffectCollection and add your
    * own effects in the constructor. It is important to put the super-call at the end and not
    * at the beginning.
    *
    * @module gs
    * @class CircularDistortionEffect
    * @extends gs.CircularDistortionEffect
    * @memberof gs
    * @constructor
    ###
    constructor: ->
        ###*
        * A circular distortion effect.
        * @property circularDistortion
        * @type gs.CircularDistortionEffect
        ###
        @circularDistortion = new gs.CircularDistortionEffect()
        
        # It is important to call super at the end, not at the beginning.
        super
 
# This line is very important, it patches the old gs.EffectCollection reference so that everywhere in
# the engine gs.EffectCollection now refers to your custom effect collection. Just uncomment it
# to use your custom effects.
# gs.EffectCollection = CustomEffectCollection
